comments.body: Was looking at the [Python docs](https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#object.__dict__) for this, will/does this also include attributes of a `Model` instance that are functions etc?

Good question, it does not include methods, but it does include whatever you assign to the objects even if it was a function. Any weird objects such as lambdas may fail to serialize to json, however, we use the same mechanism to export Model to yaml format, so such Model would not be loggable anyways.
not saying "developer api" here as it's been deemed confusing

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +26,30 @@class Model(object):
    """
    An MLflow Model that can support multiple model flavors. Provides APIs for implementing
    new Model flavors.
    """
